class.name: Vector4D
class.brief_description: Singleton with extra math functions for Vector4.
class.description: Vector4D provides extra math functions for [Vector4], supplementing the functions Godot provides in Vector4.

method.name: angle_to
method.description: Returns the unsigned minimum angle between the given vectors, in radians.

method.name: bounce
method.description: Returns [param vector] "bounced off" from a hyperplane defined by the [param normal] vector.

method.name: bounce_ratio
method.description: Returns [param vector] "bounced off" from a hyperplane defined by the [param normal] vector with the given [param bounce_ratio] defining the bounciness. For physical bouncing, realistic values are on a range of [code]0.0[/code] to [code]1.0[/code]. A ratio of [code]0.0[/code] is equivalent to [method slide], while a ratio of [code]1.0[/code] is equivalent to [method bounce].

method.name: cross
method.description: Returns the 4D analog of the cross product for this vector and [param with]. This is the unsigned area of the parallelogram formed by the two vectors. [b]Note:[/b] Cross product is not defined in 4D mathematically. This method is an analog similar to [method Vector2.cross].

method.name: from_3d
method.description: Converts a [Vector3] to a [Vector4] with the W component set to 0.

method.name: limit_length
method.description: Returns [param vector] with a maximum length by limiting its length to [param length].

method.name: move_toward
method.description: Returns [param from] moved toward [param to] by the fixed [param delta] amount. Will not go past the final value.

method.name: project
method.description: Returns [param vector] projected onto the vector [param on_normal].

method.name: reflect
method.description: Returns [param vector] reflected from a hyperplane defined by the [param normal] vector.

method.name: slide
method.description: Returns the component of [param vector] along a hyperplane defined by the [param normal] vector.

method.name: to_3d
method.description: Converts a [Vector4] to a [Vector3] by discarding the W component.
